name: Il Guelfo Bianco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for one night in July 2012. Since we were only spending one night in Florence, we wanted something that was close to most sites. The hotel is in close walking distance to everything we were interested in seeing. And it's also close to the train station. We had lunch at the restaurant and the food was excellent and the service was great too!
reviews.title: Great Location - Great Restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only minor problem - was that wifi didn't work in our room. However, it worked in the hotel. They have an area with seats in the hallway - so I used that area when I needed to get online.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location 2 blocks from Duomo. Large, comfortable room for family of 3. Nice breakfast, pleasant courtyard, wonderful helpful staff. They booked a reservation for The Accademia Museum and a great tour to Cinqueterra for us. Would definitely stay here again. Good value for a really nice stay in Florence.
reviews.title: Very clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: WOW! what a lovely hotel!! very close to pretty much everything, very quiet in the room, cleaned every day, air conditionning...everything was perfect!! we got a welcome drink and snack (bruschetta) very good, the staff was very nice, smiling and helpful. The breakfast was good, cold cuts, cheeses, fruits, eggs, and all kinds of breads, jams and juices. If we ever go back to Florence I would definetly go back to this hotel. We stayed 3 nights and we checked in early and our room was ready, fresh and beautiful.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family spent several days at this hotel. We chose the hotel because it is close to many of the popular tourist attractions and hoped that it wouldn't be too noisy. Our experience exceeded our expectations. Our hotel room was air conditioned (very welcomed in the 90+ degree weather), well-furnished and quite large. Every staff member we met was kind and helpful. In particular, the front desk staff was quite heroic in arranging an emergency dental appointment for my daughter. They had us scheduled to visit a fantastic local dentist within 24 hours and our problem was resolved with much less stress than we had anticipated. Additionally, we received prompt email communication and were given several good suggestions about local sights and tours. A great place to stay when visiting Florence!
reviews.title: great location, clean nice size room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a travel agent, so I am quite picky with my hotels & I found this hotel excellent value for money, it is extremely well kept & has everything u need. It is a lovely restored property with a perfect blend of mixing ambience of the past with all the modern ammenties you would expect . Very boutique, very well located and the staff were fantastic and extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Bella!!!! Fantastic Boutique Hotel In Great Location

likes.liked: — The boutique feel & how well restored it was & the staff
likes.disliked: — For boutique european hotels it had modern ammenties like flat screed TV, new bathrroms, securit

reviews.title: Loved this small, well-cared for Hotel
reviews.text: We recently returned from a trip to Italy and one of the highlights of our travels was our stay at the Hotel Il Guelfo Bianco - it was all any traveler could want in a small hotel. The staff was friendly, courteous, went out of their way to offer restaurant advice, tour advice. Antonella even went so far as to reserve space at The Last Supper in Milan for us - made all our resevations for everything from a private trip to "The Mall" to viewing "David" and the Uffizi. Nolen gave us restaurant advice that led us to places we would never have discovered on our own and were rewarded with wonderful food and great service. Alessio was ever-friendly and even repaired a damaged suitcase - going out of his way to help make certain we could continue traveling with it! The breakfast was good, the hotel was quiet, clean and very well-cared for - it was updated with all the modern conveniences without losing any of the appeal of being in a historic building. I would recommend staying here for anyone who is looking for a smaller hotel but still really wants something nice! Did I mention that the location was superb - steps away from the Duomo and The Academy (the David) and close to every shopping spot you could want in Florence.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic Hotel, with some of the friendliest staff in Italy! The rooms were amazing, the location is superb, only about 150m from il duomo. The airconditioning was fantastic during a particularly hot 4 days. They organised a day trip for us with pick up transfer from the hotel. The bathroom was lovely. absolutely no complaints about this place, and well deserved of their ranking in tripadvisor. easy 5/5!
reviews.title: magic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at Il Guelfo. The room had a little alcove with extra bed so our family of four could stay comfortably together. The breakfasts and the location were excellent. We could walk in a couple of minutes down to the Duomo and restaurants were abundant. The air conditioning in our room was sporadic and very hot, but once we asked, they quickly responded and lowered our temperature on the computer. Front desk service varied, from extremely helpful to courteous. But all in all, a very convenient, comfortable, lovely stay!
reviews.title: Great breakfast, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed here with my family (4 adults) for two nights in the apartment suite. The apartment is really huge, 85 sq mt is more like a house than a hotel room: a big living room, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a kitchen. The access is a little bit extrange: you need to take an elevator to the 2nd floor and then another one from the 2nd floor to the apartment that seems to be in other building.
reviews.title: Huge apartment in the heart of Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The apartment was very confortable: Decoration was good but I think other rooms were smaller but with higher decor quality. The comfort included 3 A/C, 2 flat TV, music system, free wifi and a washing machine.
reviews.title: Should have stayed longer...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is perfect, in the heart of the historical area: at 3 minutes walking to the Duomo and La Accademia, the Palazxo Medicci is in the same block of the hotel.
reviews.title: Can't think of a better place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firenze is a magic city, and staying in the Guelfo Biaco hotel turned it into an unforgettable experience.
reviews.title: Loved the Guelfo Bianco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room on the top floor was big, clean, quiet, sunny and we had a great view on Florence's rooftops.
reviews.title: Nothing Special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was really nice after a few steps and had a window too. The only con would be the shower which lacked pressure. The service was really good, helpful and friendly. The breakfast was yummy, with fresh local products.
reviews.title: Superb Location

likes.liked: — Ideal location and the character of the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I will be happy to return into this hotel, especially as we had a good deal on the room (33% off the regular price) from the hotel website.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read a lot of the other reviews I just feel I must have missed something. The hotel was generally OK. Nothing out of the ordinary. The room was big, with a separate wardrobe area leading to a good clean bathroom.
reviews.title: Serenity in the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights in Jun 2012. The hotel is only a short walk to the Cathedral and the Uffizi. Staff were very helpfull. We had a large room with a very large bathroom on the second floor, overlooking a nice garden. Because of the layout of the hotel there is a lift to the first floor and then one flight of stairs to the second. Breakfast was fairly basic but good
reviews.title: Quiet hotel in the Heart of the City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is very well located near Museum of Academia, where the David statue is.
reviews.title: Huge bedrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a room for four (2 adults + 2 children) and it had plenty of space.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Staff and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: It's not a luxury hotel but it is quite good.
reviews.title: Great city, hotel, and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decor is ancient and you feel like sleeping in a real Italian palace.
reviews.title: All-around good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed here with my husband and daughter the first week of November. We just loved this place! I cannot emphasize enough how friendly and helpful the staff were (hey Danieli and Julia and everyone!). We extended from two to three nights because the room was so big and comfortable and the hotel so convenient to many attractions. This was the least expensive hotel room we stayed in in Italy (even for a deluxe room) and yet it was our favorite.
reviews.title: Best staff ever!

likes.liked: — The helpful staff and spacious room

reviews.title: Pefectly located hotel
reviews.text: The breakfasts were great, typical of all the Italian hotels we stayed in, the room was very clean, huge, and amazingly quiet. We had to open the window at night as our room was warm and even with the window open, we hardly heard a sound all night. Make sure and ask for a room at the back of the hotel if you want this kind of quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: As we knew nothing of Florence, the staff was constantly helping to answer our questions, making dinner reservations every night, they even booked us a room in Cinque Terre as we had decided at the last minute to travel there. They gave us train schedules, made amazing restaurant recommendations...they even helped a couple of young American men we had met in Florence with their train schedule.
reviews.title: Great Location, Very Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great, just a couple of minutes from the Duomo (make sure and climb to the top of the dome!). I also must add that the staff recommended La Giostra for dinner (and made us a key reservation as we couldn't have gotten in without one). This dinner was one of my favorite memories of Italy. Delicious food in a beautiful, warm setting. What a night! The hotel is also a few steps from the outdoor market which was a blast and where we found great bargains on leather and scarves and all sorts of fun things.
reviews.title: Nice Little Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel Il Guelfo Bianco is perfectly located near all the main attractions and within walking distance of the railway station. Our superior room on the first floor was spacious and immaculately furnished with original antiques. The hotel staff were exemplary and nothing was too much trouble. This hotel comes with a AAAAA recommendation.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: My home in Florence.
reviews.title: Love the Guelfo Bianco!

likes.liked: — The location, the room and the service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I absolutely loved my 10 days in Jul/Aug at this hotel. It was one of the highlights of my trip to Italy, and I would highly recommend to any one thinking of a central hotel in Florence. Do not bother with any other hotel, this is one of the very best hotels that I have ever stayed in anywhere.
reviews.title: Best hotel experience ever

likes.liked: — The unique and thoughtful design and beauty of the hotel and its rooms
likes.disliked: — There was nothing I disliked about this hotel. Seriously!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is in a league of its own compared to lots of hotels in Florence, and Italy for that matter. It is great value for a three star hotel, as it has the rooms, staff and overall service of a higher rating hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel, Highly Recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To begin with the Location is unbeatable for getting around Florence hot spots. Located in via Cavour, you can walk to anywhere of interest, all the sights, museums, galleries etc.
reviews.title: Wonderful stop for Honeymoon!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It’s only 3 mins walk down to the Doumo, the famous Florence leather market is 2 mins away, so is the food markets ( yum-don’t miss it!), and then everything else in pretty much a 10-15 walk, Uffizi, Pitti Palace, Ponte Vecchio.
reviews.title: Perfect location

likes.liked: — The location and friendliness of staff
likes.disliked: — If pushed to say anything, then I'd say that the air conditioning was sometimes a little noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is listed as a 3 star, but was much nicer than other 3 stars we stayed at. I definitely felt pampered at Il Guelfo Bianco and thought maybe I had booked a 4 star without realizing. We stayed in November and our rates were well under half what the summer rates are so we got an amazing value at just 100 Euro per night.
reviews.title: Best Hotel we stayed at in Italy and amazing value during winter

likes.disliked: — Pay extra for fruit at breakfast - but this is pretty common.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathrooms - large, modern, clean, tasteful
reviews.title: One of the best values in Italy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms - large, quiet, and modern, but with antique character of the building showing through. Great minibar and large (for italy) flatscreen TV with channels in all languages.
reviews.title: A Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast - Great service, great food, breakfast room is very nice - in good weather you can sit on the patio. Cheeses and meats included. Pay extra for fruit.
reviews.title: We loved Il Guelfo Bianco

likes.liked: — The wonderful, cheerful, friendly, helpful staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Front Desk - extremely helpful in directions, recommendations, calling taxi, etc.
reviews.title: Wonderful Find in Florence

likes.liked: — Spacious room, great value, good location, friendly service.
likes.disliked: — Beds weren't the most comfy, but adequate. ( I slept quite well!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have spent two weeks in Italy with my wife and two teenagers. We have chosen Il Guelfo Bianco due to its location and the choice was perfect. Hotel is close to everything you want to see in Firenze, even allowing some rest in those warm summer days without losing your precious time. Booking was correct and it present valuable options of booking your tickets to Accademia and Uffizi, a must if you want to avoid long waiting lines. They also helped me on finding a Portuguese-speaker guide - an excellent one - and made all the arrangements on my behalf. Rooms are very good, clean, well decorated and comfortable.Breakfast is also pretty good. If you have a car, be prepared for a high parking rate, more than 30 Euros a day. They take care of it. Just had a little problem with my TV, not fixed, but it didn't make any difference.
reviews.title: Comfortable choice, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: myself and a friend spent 4 days and nights in florence staying at this beautiful hotel.Small and intimate but by no means claustophobic,this hotel had loads of charm and character,and with it's very central location,would be very hard to beat as a holiday base.The staff were so friendly,courtious and attentive.Continental breakfast was excellent,always replenished when guests came and went,beds made by the time we came back from breakfast.Beautiful courtyard optional as a dining area in the morning also we had a lovely veranda on the 4th floor.the staff also booked tickets for the Ufizzi museum for us which saved us a great deal of time.overall an excellent stay,excellent staff,excellent location,will be back,
reviews.title: 4 day stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Vincent Moore
reviews.title: Fantastic Firenze from a Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: How else to enjoy Florence than in the heart of the city-- delightful hotel with comfortable rooms, a quiet courtyard, superb staff at the front desk especially professional and knowledgeable staff like Antonella, and an excellent bistro next door-- Il Desco Bistrot (that serves you a welcome drink but you would be remiss not to have your meal there; the gazpacho and bruschetta are as good can be found anywhere, while other dishes and the wine are also superb!
reviews.title: Perfect place to enjoy Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And the location! It is in walking distance of the shops, of Il Duomo, Uffizi, Accademia... we had pleasant walks even further to Ponte Vecchio and Piazalle Michelangelo. Staying at Il Guelfo Blanco made our Florence visit just wonderful!
reviews.title: A safe bet, but nothing to write home about

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel website really didn't do justice to this hotel which was a pleasant surprise. The art work spread throughout the hotel is great adding to the relaxing homelike feel. Located a easy walk down the street to the main square really made getting around easy. Staff was very helpful confirming our choices in restaurants and getting cabs when required. Couldn't beat the size of the room!
reviews.title: Il Guelfo Bianco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for a 4-night stay in September based on other TripAdivsor recommendations and we weren't disappointed. Only two blocks from the Piazza del Duomo, it makes a superb base for exploring this beautiful city.
reviews.title: Great base for exploring

likes.liked: — Location close to centre of city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our bedroom, away from the main street as we had requested, was in the original part of the building, and the wooden panelling and high ceilings added a touch of character lacking in most modern hotels. The room was large by European standards, as was the en-suite which included a full-size bath - just ideal for relaxing after a day's sightseeing. The only potential issue was the poorly fitting windows but the autumn temperatures were still high enough for this not to present any real problem.
reviews.title: Superb hotel in the best location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008
reviews.text: The breakfast room was bright and airy, and the selection on offer varied each day, with home-made items being added to the standard supply of cereals, fruit, croissants, cold meats and cheese. The multi-lingual staff were always helpful without being pushy.
reviews.title: Very good, comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will certainly stay here again on our next visit to Florence.
reviews.title: I would highly recommend the Il Guelfo in Florence

description: Our hotel is right in the city center, between Piazza Duomo e Piazza San Marco , few steps far from Accademia (the museum where you can see the fanous DAVID by Michelangelo). It's house in two late 15th century building next each other. All rooms are different in size and position - executiev rooms have a standard size - sueprior rooms are larger - de luxe and jurior suite are very large with a sitting area. We have rooms overlooking the courtyard, gardens and several rooms overlloking Via Cavour which is the main street but 70% pedestrain and so it's not too noisy. All rooms have triple glasses and double windows. WI/FI available in all the rooms and the drawing rooms and it's free of charge if you have yoru own laptop or i-phone or i-pad. Bistrot restaurant next door "IL DESCO" open every day (11 till 8,30 pm) with good menu' all day long (many organic products directly by the owner's farm.
